sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

ki review:

mi pu ki klama = ? (what does ki do?)

(Answer: Sets past tense as default for following sentences)

New Material (5-7 min)

The roi Counter

roi attaches to numbers to count occurrences:

Expression Meaning
paroi once
reroi twice
ciroi three times
so'iroi many times
noroi never (zero times)
roroi always (every time)

Using roi

mi reroi klama la .paris.

I went to Paris twice.

mi so'iroi viska lo mlatu

I saw the cat many times.

mi noroi citka lo rectu

I never eat meat.

Position

roi typically comes after the tense or at the start of selbri:

mi pu reroi klama

I went twice (in the past).

mi reroi pu klama

Twice I went (in the past). (Same meaning)

Habits

mi ro djedi ciroi citka

I eat three times every day.

Key Point

roi + number counts how many times something happens.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Basic roi

Translate:

  1. I went once.
  2. She called twice.
  3. They visited three times.
Answers
  1. mi paroi klama
  2. ri reroi finti lo fonxa or ri reroi fonxa
  3. ri'i ciroi vitke

Exercise 2: With Numbers

Translate:

  1. I read the book many times.
  2. I never eat fish.
  3. I always sleep at night.
Answers
  1. mi so'iroi tcidu lo cukta
  2. mi noroi citka lo finpe
  3. mi roroi sipna ca lo nicte

Exercise 3: Habits

Translate:

  1. I exercise twice a day.
  2. I study Lojban three times a week.
  3. I travel once a year.
Answers
  1. mi reroi ro djedi xadni (exercise) or mi reroi ro djedi briju
  2. mi ciroi ro jeftu tadni la .jbobau.
  3. mi paroi ro nanca litru

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Describe your habits:

Example:

mi ciroi ro djedi citka
.i mi paroi ro jeftu klama lo zarci
.i mi so'iroi tcidu lo cukta

(I eat three times every day. I go to the store once a week. I read books many times.)

Summary

You learned roi for counting repetitions. Combine with numbers for precise frequency.
